definition: to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
inscribed bamboo stick (used in divination, gambling, drawing lots etc)/small wood sliver/label/tag

sentences.english: Fortunately, most of our water supply is renewed annually as snowpack in the Rockies.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，我们大部分的供水续签每年积雪的落基山。

sentences.english: Visa renewals are no longer routine.
sentences.chinese: 签证续签不再如以往般轻而易举。

sentences.english: How to deal with cases where outsourcing staff suffer from work-related injury?
sentences.chinese: 没有续签处于三期的妇女员工，该如何处理？

sentences.english: Some members were being told to return to their home countries in order to apply for business visa renewals.
sentences.chinese: 一些会员被告知要返回本国才能申请商务签证续签。

sentences.english: And the Lakers hope to sign Ariza this summer.
sentences.chinese: 并且，这个赛季结束的夏天，湖人希望续签阿里扎。

sentences.english: Check-list of employment labor contract and renew;
sentences.chinese: 公司员工合同签订和续签统计表。

sentences.english: But oil companies are still eager to get renewal discussions over with and sign deals.
sentences.chinese: 但石油公司仍渴望就续签事宜进行讨论并签订协议。

definition: labor contract/contract between employer and employees governing wages and conditions
to fall due (loan etc)/to expire (visa etc)/to mature (investment bond etc)
to renew a certificate (ID card etc)/to leave an ID at the desk to gain entrance
to terminate an agreement/to cancel a contract
to agree to and sign (a treaty etc)
